description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Dec. 19, 2016 /PRNewswire/ - Sun Life Financial Inc. (SLF) (SLF) ("Sun Life Financial") today announced that after having taken into account all election notices received by the December 16, 2016 deadline for the conversion of its Class A Non-Cumulative Rate Reset Preferred Shares Series 12R (the "Series 12R Shares") into Class A Non-Cumulative Floating Rate Preferred Shares Series 13QR (the "Series 13QR Shares"), there were 832,321 Series 12R Shares tendered for conversion, which is less than the one million shares required to give effect to conversions into Series 13QR Shares, meaning there will be no conversion of Series 12R Shares into Series 13QR Shares. For the five-year period commencing on December 31, 2016 to but excluding December 31, 2021, holders of the Series 12R Shares will be entitled to receive non-cumulative preferential cash dividends on a quarterly basis, as and when declared by the Board of Directors of Sun Life Financial and subject to the Insurance Companies Act (Canada), based on an annual dividend rate of 3.806% per annum or $0.237875 per share per quarter, being equal to the sum of the 5-year Government of Canada Yield, as defined in the terms of the Series 12R Shares, on Thursday, December 1, 2016 plus 2.73%, as determined in accordance with the terms of those shares.
title: Sun Life Financial Provides Update on Conversion Privilege for its Class A Non-Cumulative Rate Reset Preferred Shares Series 12R

description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Dec. 13, 2016 /CNW/ - Sun Life Financial is amplifying its commitment to bring innovative digital capabilities to Canadians with the launch of the industry's first national healthcare provider ratings network, available in English and French through the my Sun Life mobile app. Powered by millions of Sun Life group benefits plan members and 100,000 healthcare providers, the network allows clients to search for local healthcare providers such as: chiropractors, massage therapists, acupuncturists, physiotherapists, podiatrists, chiropodists, naturopaths, osteopaths and psychologists. "Our clients have told us that a major hurdle for them in managing their health and well-being was having a trusted resource for finding a healthcare provider closest to them," explains Chris Denys, Senior Vice-President of Possibilities, Digital Health Solutions, Sun Life Financial Canada.
title: Sun Life first Canadian insurer to launch National Healthcare Provider Ratings Network

title: Seventy-seven per cent of Canadians feel entitled to workplace health benefits

description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Feb. 1, 2017 /CNW/ - Entitled is not a word typically used to describe Canadians, but when it comes to workplace health benefits, some believe these plans are a right. According to the most recent Sun Life Canadian Health Index, 77 per cent of Canadians surveyed feel all employees are entitled to receive a health benefits plan sponsored by their employer.
title: Seventy-seven per cent of Canadians feel entitled to workplace health benefits

description: [PR Newswire] - WELLESLEY, Mass. and KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 7, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- As pitchers and catchers get ready to report to spring training next week, the Kansas City Royals and Sun Life Financial U.S. have announced a partnership through the 2020 season. Working together, Sun Life and the Royals will raise funds and hold community events aimed at promoting diabetes awareness, as well as health and physical activity. "We are looking forward to working with the Royals because they have such a strong and active presence in this region," said Dan Fishbein, President of Sun Life Financial U.S. "We're thrilled to partner with an organization that shares our commitment to health and wellness, and I can't wait to see what this partnership brings to the Greater Kansas City area communities.
title: Sun Life Financial announces new partnership with Kansas City Royals
